title: The Unseen Guardian: The Story of Alice Nelson
summary: Alice Nelson, a 51-year-old tutor, discovers her ability to become invisible and uses it to protect her community over the course of a week.
summaryGerman: Alice Nelson, eine 51-jährige Lehrerin, entdeckt ihre Fähigkeit, unsichtbar zu werden und nutzt diese, um eine Woche lang ihre Gemeinde zu schützen.
summaryDutch: Alice Nelson, een 51-jarige tutor, ontdekt haar vermogen om onzichtbaar te worden en gebruikt dit om haar gemeenschap een week lang te beschermen.
summaryFrench: Alice Nelson, une tutrice de 51 ans, découvre sa capacité à devenir invisible et l'utilise pour protéger sa communauté pendant une semaine.

story.text: Alice Nelson, while mentoring a young student, accidentally discovers that she can turn invisible. Amazed and a bit bewildered, she spends the day testing her new ability.
Feeling more confident, Alice decides to use her power for good. She stops a theft at a local shop by startling the thief while invisible, who then flees empty-handed.
Alice helps a lost child find their parents, guiding them unseen through the crowded streets. The parents are grateful, and the child is safe, enhancing Alice’s resolve to help anonymously.
Using her power, Alice confronts a group of bullies without revealing herself; she whispers warnings to them, causing them to flee in fear. No children are harmed that day.
Exhausted but determined, Alice spends the day tutoring. She secretly uses her invisibility to better understand her students' struggles without making them feel watched.
During a community meeting, Alice overhears a plot to vandalize a local park. She prepares to intervene that night.
Alice successfully prevents the vandalism using her invisibility. The park remains a safe haven for families and her neighbors remain unaware of their unseen guardian.

ending: And so, Alice Nelson continued to guard her neighborhood, invisible but ever-watchful, a true hero unseen.
moral: True heroism doesn't always need to be seen to make a difference.
